clauses-english.clause: Ta,
Seen,
Meem.

2934.verse-english: These are the verses of the clear Book.

clauses-english.clause: These are the verses of the clear Book.

2935.verse-arabic: لَعَلَّكَ بَاخِعٌ نَّفْسَكَ أَلَّا يَكُونُوا مُؤْمِنِينَ
2935.verse-english: Perhaps, [O Muhammad], you would kill yourself with grief that they will not be believers.

clauses-english.clause: Perhaps,
[O Muhammad],
you would kill yourself with grief that they will not be believers.

2936.verse-arabic: إِن نَّشَأْ نُنَزِّلْ عَلَيْهِم مِّنَ السَّمَاءِ آيَةً فَظَلَّتْ أَعْنَاقُهُمْ لَهَا خَاضِعِينَ
2936.verse-english: If We willed, We could send down to them from the sky a sign for which their necks would remain humbled.

clauses-english.clause: If We willed,
We could send down to them from the sky a sign for which their necks would remain humbled.

2937.verse-arabic: وَمَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن ذِكْرٍ مِّنَ الرَّحْمَٰنِ مُحْدَثٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا عَنْهُ مُعْرِضِينَ
2937.verse-english: And no revelation comes to them anew from the Most Merciful except that they turn away from it.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَمَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن ذِكْرٍ مِّنَ الرَّحْمَٰنِ مُحْدَثٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا عَنْهُ مُعْرِضِينَ

clauses-english.clause: And no revelation comes to them anew from the Most Merciful except that they turn away from it.

2938.verse-arabic: فَقَدْ كَذَّبُوا فَسَيَأْتِيهِمْ أَنبَاءُ مَا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ
2938.verse-english: For they have already denied, but there will come to them the news of that which they used to ridicule.

clauses-english.clause: For they have already denied,
but there will come to them the news of that which they used to ridicule.

2939.verse-arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا إِلَى الْأَرْضِ كَمْ أَنبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوْجٍ كَرِيمٍ
2939.verse-english: Did they not look at the earth - how much We have produced therein from every noble kind?

clauses-english.clause: Did they not look at the earth -
how much We have produced therein from every noble kind?

2940.verse-arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
2940.verse-english: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed in that is a sign,
but most of them were not to be believers.

2941.verse-english: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

clauses-english.clause: And indeed,
your Lord -
He is the Exalted in Might,
the Merciful.

2942.verse-arabic: وَإِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبُّكَ مُوسَىٰ أَنِ ائْتِ الْقَوْمَ الظَّالِمِينَ
2942.verse-english: And [mention] when your Lord called Moses, [saying], "Go to the wrongdoing people -

clauses-english.clause: And [mention] when your Lord called Moses,
[saying],
"Go to the wrongdoing people -

2943.verse-english: The people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear Allah?"

clauses-english.clause: The people of Pharaoh.
Will they not fear God?

2944.verse-arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي أَخَافُ أَن يُكَذِّبُونِ
2944.verse-english: He said, "My Lord, indeed I fear that they will deny me

clauses-english.clause: He said,
"My Lord,
indeed I fear that they will deny me

2945.verse-arabic: وَيَضِيقُ صَدْرِي وَلَا يَنطَلِقُ لِسَانِي فَأَرْسِلْ إِلَىٰ هَارُونَ
2945.verse-english: And that my breast will tighten and my tongue will not be fluent, so send for Aaron.

clauses-english.clause: And that my breast will tighten and my tongue will not be fluent,
so send for Aaron.

2946.verse-arabic: وَلَهُمْ عَلَيَّ ذَنبٌ فَأَخَافُ أَن يَقْتُلُونِ
2946.verse-english: And they have upon me a [claim due to] sin, so I fear that they will kill me."

clauses-english.clause: And they have upon me a [claim due to] sin,
so I fear that they will kill me.

2947.verse-arabic: قَالَ كَلَّا ۖ فَاذْهَبَا بِآيَاتِنَا ۖ إِنَّا مَعَكُم مُّسْتَمِعُونَ
2947.verse-english: [Allah] said, "No. Go both of you with Our signs; indeed, We are with you, listening.

clauses-english.clause: [God] said,
"No.
Go both of you with Our signs;
indeed,
We are with you,
listening.

2948.verse-arabic: فَأْتِيَا فِرْعَوْنَ فَقُولَا إِنَّا رَسُولُ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
2948.verse-english: Go to Pharaoh and say, 'We are the messengers of the Lord of the worlds,

clauses-english.clause: Go to Pharaoh and say,
'We are the messengers of the Lord of the worlds,

2949.verse-english: [Commanded to say], "Send with us the Children of Israel."'"

clauses-english.clause: [Commanded to say],
"Send with us the Children of Israel.

2950.verse-arabic: قَالَ أَلَمْ نُرَبِّكَ فِينَا وَلِيدًا وَلَبِثْتَ فِينَا مِنْ عُمُرِكَ سِنِينَ
2950.verse-english: [Pharaoh] said, "Did we not raise you among us as a child, and you remained among us for years of your life?

clauses-english.clause: [Pharaoh] said,
"Did we not raise you among us as a child,
and you remained among us for years of your life?

2951.verse-arabic: وَفَعَلْتَ فَعْلَتَكَ الَّتِي فَعَلْتَ وَأَنتَ مِنَ الْكَافِرِينَ
2951.verse-english: And [then] you did your deed which you did, and you were of the ungrateful."

clauses-english.clause: And [then] you did your deed which you did,
and you were of the ungrateful.

2952.verse-arabic: قَالَ فَعَلْتُهَا إِذًا وَأَنَا مِنَ الضَّالِّينَ
2952.verse-english: [Moses] said, "I did it, then, while I was of those astray.

clauses-english.clause: [Moses] said,
"I did it,
then,
while I was of those astray.

2953.verse-arabic: فَفَرَرْتُ مِنكُمْ لَمَّا خِفْتُكُمْ فَوَهَبَ لِي رَبِّي حُكْمًا وَجَعَلَنِي مِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
2953.verse-english: So I fled from you when I feared you. Then my Lord granted me wisdom and prophethood and appointed me [as one] of the messengers.

clauses-english.clause: So I fled from you when I feared you.
Then my Lord granted me wisdom and prophethood and appointed me [as one] of the messengers.

2954.verse-arabic: وَتِلْكَ نِعْمَةٌ تَمُنُّهَا عَلَيَّ أَنْ عَبَّدتَّ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ
2954.verse-english: And is this a favor of which you remind me - that you have enslaved the Children of Israel?"

clauses-english.clause: And is this a favor of which you remind me -
that you have enslaved the Children of Israel?

2955.verse-english: Said Pharaoh, "And what is the Lord of the worlds?"

clauses-english.clause: Said Pharaoh,
"And what is the Lord of the worlds?

2956.verse-arabic: قَالَ رَبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ إِن كُنتُم مُّوقِنِينَ
2956.verse-english: [Moses] said, "The Lord of the heavens and earth and that between them, if you should be convinced."

clauses-english.clause: [Moses] said,
"The Lord of the heavens and earth and that between them,
if you should be convinced.

2957.verse-english: [Pharaoh] said to those around him, "Do you not hear?"

clauses-english.clause: [Pharaoh] said to those around him,
"Do you not hear?

2958.verse-english: [Moses] said, "Your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers."

clauses-english.clause: [Moses] said,
"Your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers.

2959.verse-arabic: قَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَكُمُ الَّذِي أُرْسِلَ إِلَيْكُمْ لَمَجْنُونٌ
2959.verse-english: [Pharaoh] said, "Indeed, your 'messenger' who has been sent to you is mad."

clauses-english.clause: [Pharaoh] said,
"Indeed,
your 'messenger' who has been sent to you is mad.

2960.verse-arabic: قَالَ رَبُّ الْمَشْرِقِ وَالْمَغْرِبِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
2960.verse-english: [Moses] said, "Lord of the east and the west and that between them, if you were to reason."

clauses-english.clause: [Moses] said,
"Lord of the east and the west and that between them,
if you were to reason.

2961.verse-arabic: قَالَ لَئِنِ اتَّخَذْتَ إِلَٰهًا غَيْرِي لَأَجْعَلَنَّكَ مِنَ الْمَسْجُونِينَ
2961.verse-english: [Pharaoh] said, "If you take a god other than me, I will surely place you among those imprisoned."

clauses-english.clause: [Pharaoh] said,
"If you take a god other than me,
I will surely place you among those imprisoned.

2962.verse-english: [Moses] said, "Even if I brought you proof manifest?"

clauses-english.clause: [Moses] said,
"Even if I brought you proof manifest?

2963.verse-arabic: قَالَ فَأْتِ بِهِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ
2963.verse-english: [Pharaoh] said, "Then bring it, if you should be of the truthful."

clauses-english.clause: [Pharaoh] said,
"Then bring it,
if you should be of the truthful.

2964.verse-arabic: فَأَلْقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ ثُعْبَانٌ مُّبِينٌ
2964.verse-english: So [Moses] threw his staff, and suddenly it was a serpent manifest.

clauses-english.clause: So [Moses] threw his staff,
and suddenly it was a serpent manifest.

2965.verse-arabic: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ بَيْضَاءُ لِلنَّاظِرِينَ
2965.verse-english: And he drew out his hand; thereupon it was white for the observers.

clauses-english.clause: And he drew out his hand;
thereupon it was white for the observers.

2966.verse-arabic: قَالَ لِلْمَلَإِ حَوْلَهُ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَسَاحِرٌ عَلِيمٌ
2966.verse-english: [Pharaoh] said to the eminent ones around him, "Indeed, this is a learned magician.

clauses-english.clause: [Pharaoh] said to the eminent ones around him,
"Indeed,
this is a learned magician.

2967.verse-arabic: يُرِيدُ أَن يُخْرِجَكُم مِّنْ أَرْضِكُم بِسِحْرِهِ فَمَاذَا تَأْمُرُونَ
2967.verse-english: He wants to drive you out of your land by his magic, so what do you advise?"

clauses-english.clause: He wants to drive you out of your land by his magic,
so what do you advise?

2968.verse-arabic: قَالُوا أَرْجِهْ وَأَخَاهُ وَابْعَثْ فِي الْمَدَائِنِ حَاشِرِينَ
2968.verse-english: They said, "Postpone [the matter of] him and his brother and send among the cities gatherers

clauses-english.clause: They said,
"Postpone [the matter of] him and his brother and send among the cities gatherers

2969.verse-english: Who will bring you every learned, skilled magician."

clauses-english.clause: Who will bring you every learned,
skilled magician.

2970.verse-english: So the magicians were assembled for the appointment of a well-known day.

clauses-english.clause: So the magicians were assembled for the appointment of a well-
known day.

2971.verse-english: And it was said to the people, "Will you congregate

clauses-english.clause: And it was said to the people,
"Will you congregate

2972.verse-arabic: لَعَلَّنَا نَتَّبِعُ السَّحَرَةَ إِن كَانُوا هُمُ الْغَالِبِينَ
2972.verse-english: That we might follow the magicians if they are the predominant?"

clauses-english.clause: That we might follow the magicians if they are the predominant?

2973.verse-arabic: فَلَمَّا جَاءَ السَّحَرَةُ قَالُوا لِفِرْعَوْنَ أَئِنَّ لَنَا لَأَجْرًا إِن كُنَّا نَحْنُ الْغَالِبِينَ
2973.verse-english: And when the magicians arrived, they said to Pharaoh, "Is there indeed for us a reward if we are the predominant?"

clauses-english.clause: And when the magicians arrived,
they said to Pharaoh,
"Is there indeed for us a reward if we are the predominant?

2974.verse-arabic: قَالَ نَعَمْ وَإِنَّكُمْ إِذًا لَّمِنَ الْمُقَرَّبِينَ
2974.verse-english: He said, "Yes, and indeed, you will then be of those near [to me]."

clauses-english.clause: He said,
"Yes,
and indeed,
you will then be of those near [to me].

2975.verse-arabic: قَالَ لَهُم مُّوسَىٰ أَلْقُوا مَا أَنتُم مُّلْقُونَ
2975.verse-english: Moses said to them, "Throw whatever you will throw."

clauses-english.clause: Moses said to them,
"Throw whatever you will throw.

2976.verse-arabic: فَأَلْقَوْا حِبَالَهُمْ وَعِصِيَّهُمْ وَقَالُوا بِعِزَّةِ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّا لَنَحْنُ الْغَالِبُونَ
2976.verse-english: So they threw their ropes and their staffs and said, "By the might of Pharaoh, indeed it is we who are predominant."

clauses-english.clause: So they threw their ropes and their staffs and said,
"By the might of Pharaoh,
indeed it is we who are predominant.

2977.verse-arabic: فَأَلْقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ تَلْقَفُ مَا يَأْفِكُونَ
2977.verse-english: Then Moses threw his staff, and at once it devoured what they falsified.

clauses-english.clause: Then Moses threw his staff,
and at once it devoured what they falsified.

2978.verse-english: So the magicians fell down in prostration [to Allah].

clauses-english.clause: So the magicians fell down in prostration [to God].

2979.verse-english: They said, "We have believed in the Lord of the worlds,

clauses-english.clause: They said,
"We have believed in the Lord of the worlds,

2980.verse-english: The Lord of Moses and Aaron."

clauses-english.clause: The Lord of Moses and Aaron.

2981.verse-arabic: قَالَ آمَنتُمْ لَهُ قَبْلَ أَنْ آذَنَ لَكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ الَّذِي عَلَّمَكُمُ السِّحْرَ فَلَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ ۚ لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيْدِيَكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُم مِّنْ خِلَافٍ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
2981.verse-english: [Pharaoh] said, "You believed Moses before I gave you permission. Indeed, he is your leader who has taught you magic, but you are going to know. I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will surely crucify you all."

clauses-english.clause: [Pharaoh] said,
"You believed Moses before I gave you permission.
Indeed,
he is your leader who has taught you magic,
but you are going to know.
I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides,
and I will surely crucify you all.

2982.verse-arabic: قَالُوا لَا ضَيْرَ ۖ إِنَّا إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا مُنقَلِبُونَ
2982.verse-english: They said, "No harm. Indeed, to our Lord we will return.

clauses-english.clause: They said,
"No harm.
Indeed,
to our Lord we will return.

2983.verse-arabic: إِنَّا نَطْمَعُ أَن يَغْفِرَ لَنَا رَبُّنَا خَطَايَانَا أَن كُنَّا أَوَّلَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
2983.verse-english: Indeed, we aspire that our Lord will forgive us our sins because we were the first of the believers."

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
we aspire that our Lord will forgive us our sins because we were the first of the believers.

2984.verse-arabic: ۞ وَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ أَنْ أَسْرِ بِعِبَادِي إِنَّكُم مُّتَّبَعُونَ
2984.verse-english: And We inspired to Moses, "Travel by night with My servants; indeed, you will be pursued."

clauses-english.clause: And We inspired to Moses,
"Travel by night with My servants;
indeed,
you will be pursued.

2985.verse-english: Then Pharaoh sent among the cities gatherers

clauses-english.clause: Then Pharaoh sent among the cities gatherers

2986.verse-english: [And said], "Indeed, those are but a small band,

clauses-english.clause: [And said],
"Indeed,
those are but a small band,

2987.verse-english: And indeed, they are enraging us,

clauses-english.clause: And indeed,
they are enraging us,

2988.verse-english: And indeed, we are a cautious society... "

clauses-english.clause: And indeed,
we are a cautious society...

2989.verse-english: So We removed them from gardens and springs

clauses-english.clause: So We removed them from gardens and springs
And treasures and honorable station -

2991.verse-english: Thus. And We caused to inherit it the Children of Israel.

clauses-english.clause: Thus.
And We caused to inherit it the Children of Israel.

2992.verse-english: So they pursued them at sunrise.

clauses-english.clause: So they pursued them at sunrise.

2993.verse-arabic: فَلَمَّا تَرَاءَى الْجَمْعَانِ قَالَ أَصْحَابُ مُوسَىٰ إِنَّا لَمُدْرَكُونَ
2993.verse-english: And when the two companies saw one another, the companions of Moses said, "Indeed, we are to be overtaken!"

clauses-english.clause: And when the two companies saw one another,
the companions of Moses said,
"Indeed,
we are to be overtaken!

2994.verse-arabic: قَالَ كَلَّا ۖ إِنَّ مَعِيَ رَبِّي سَيَهْدِينِ
2994.verse-english: [Moses] said, "No! Indeed, with me is my Lord; He will guide me."

clauses-english.clause: [Moses] said,
"No!
Indeed,
with me is my Lord;
He will guide me.

2995.verse-arabic: فَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ أَنِ اضْرِب بِّعَصَاكَ الْبَحْرَ ۖ فَانفَلَقَ فَكَانَ كُلُّ فِرْقٍ كَالطَّوْدِ الْعَظِيمِ
2995.verse-english: Then We inspired to Moses, "Strike with your staff the sea," and it parted, and each portion was like a great towering mountain.

clauses-english.clause: Then We inspired to Moses,
"Strike with your staff the sea,
" and it parted,
and each portion was like a great towering mountain.

2996.verse-english: And We advanced thereto the pursuers.

clauses-english.clause: And We advanced thereto the pursuers.

2997.verse-english: And We saved Moses and those with him, all together.

clauses-english.clause: And We saved Moses and those with him,
all together.
Then We drowned the others.

2999.verse-arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
2999.verse-english: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed in that is a sign,
but most of them were not to be believers.

3000.verse-english: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

clauses-english.clause: And indeed,
your Lord -
He is the Exalted in Might,
the Merciful.

3001.verse-english: And recite to them the news of Abraham,

clauses-english.clause: And recite to them the news of Abraham,

3002.verse-arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ
3002.verse-english: When he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?"

clauses-english.clause: When he said to his father and his people,
"What do you worship?

3003.verse-arabic: قَالُوا نَعْبُدُ أَصْنَامًا فَنَظَلُّ لَهَا عَاكِفِينَ
3003.verse-english: They said, "We worship idols and remain to them devoted."

clauses-english.clause: They said,
"We worship idols and remain to them devoted.

3004.verse-english: He said, "Do they hear you when you supplicate?

clauses-english.clause: He said,
"Do they hear you when you supplicate?

3005.verse-english: Or do they benefit you, or do they harm?"

clauses-english.clause: Or do they benefit you,
or do they harm?

3006.verse-arabic: قَالُوا بَلْ وَجَدْنَا آبَاءَنَا كَذَٰلِكَ يَفْعَلُونَ
3006.verse-english: They said, "But we found our fathers doing thus."

clauses-english.clause: They said,
"But we found our fathers doing thus.

3007.verse-english: He said, "Then do you see what you have been worshipping,

clauses-english.clause: He said,
"Then do you see what you have been worshipping,
You and your ancient forefathers?

3009.verse-arabic: فَإِنَّهُمْ عَدُوٌّ لِّي إِلَّا رَبَّ الْعَالَمِينَ
3009.verse-english: Indeed, they are enemies to me, except the Lord of the worlds,

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
they are enemies to me,
except the Lord of the worlds,

3010.verse-english: Who created me, and He [it is who] guides me.

clauses-english.clause: Who created me,
and He [it is who] guides me.

3011.verse-english: And it is He who feeds me and gives me drink.

clauses-english.clause: And it is He who feeds me and gives me drink.

3012.verse-english: And when I am ill, it is He who cures me

clauses-english.clause: And when I am ill,
it is He who cures me

3013.verse-english: And who will cause me to die and then bring me to life

clauses-english.clause: And who will cause me to die and then bring me to life

3014.verse-arabic: وَالَّذِي أَطْمَعُ أَن يَغْفِرَ لِي خَطِيئَتِي يَوْمَ الدِّينِ
3014.verse-english: And who I aspire that He will forgive me my sin on the Day of Recompense."

clauses-english.clause: And who I aspire that He will forgive me my sin on the Day of Recompense.

3015.verse-arabic: رَبِّ هَبْ لِي حُكْمًا وَأَلْحِقْنِي بِالصَّالِحِينَ
3015.verse-english: [And he said], "My Lord, grant me authority and join me with the righteous.

clauses-english.clause: [And he said],
"My Lord,
grant me authority and join me with the righteous.

3016.verse-arabic: وَاجْعَل لِّي لِسَانَ صِدْقٍ فِي الْآخِرِينَ
3016.verse-english: And grant me a reputation of honor among later generations.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَاجْعَل لِّي لِسَانَ صِدْقٍ فِي الْآخِرِينَ

clauses-english.clause: And grant me a reputation of honor among later generations.

3017.verse-english: And place me among the inheritors of the Garden of Pleasure.

clauses-english.clause: And place me among the inheritors of the Garden of Pleasure.

3018.verse-arabic: وَاغْفِرْ لِأَبِي إِنَّهُ كَانَ مِنَ الضَّالِّينَ
3018.verse-english: And forgive my father. Indeed, he has been of those astray.

clauses-english.clause: And forgive my father.
Indeed,
he has been of those astray.

3019.verse-english: And do not disgrace me on the Day they are [all] resurrected -

clauses-english.clause: And do not disgrace me on the Day they are [all] resurrected -

3020.verse-arabic: يَوْمَ لَا يَنفَعُ مَالٌ وَلَا بَنُونَ
3020.verse-english: The Day when there will not benefit [anyone] wealth or children

clauses-arabic.clause: يَوْمَ لَا يَنفَعُ مَالٌ وَلَا بَنُونَ

clauses-english.clause: The Day when there will not benefit [anyone] wealth or children

3021.verse-arabic: إِلَّا مَنْ أَتَى اللَّهَ بِقَلْبٍ سَلِيمٍ
3021.verse-english: But only one who comes to Allah with a sound heart."

clauses-english.clause: But only one who comes to God with a sound heart.

3022.verse-english: And Paradise will be brought near [that Day] to the righteous.

clauses-english.clause: And Paradise will be brought near [that Day] to the righteous.

3023.verse-english: And Hellfire will be brought forth for the deviators,

clauses-english.clause: And Hellfire will be brought forth for the deviators,

3024.verse-arabic: وَقِيلَ لَهُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْبُدُونَ
3024.verse-english: And it will be said to them, "Where are those you used to worship

clauses-english.clause: And it will be said to them,
"Where are those you used to worship

3025.verse-arabic: مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ هَلْ يَنصُرُونَكُمْ أَوْ يَنتَصِرُونَ
3025.verse-english: Other than Allah? Can they help you or help themselves?"

clauses-english.clause: Other than God?
Can they help you or help themselves?

3026.verse-english: So they will be overturned into Hellfire, they and the deviators

clauses-english.clause: So they will be overturned into Hellfire,
they and the deviators

3027.verse-english: And the soldiers of Iblees, all together.

clauses-english.clause: And the soldiers of Iblees,
all together.

3028.verse-english: They will say while they dispute therein,

clauses-english.clause: They will say while they dispute therein,

3029.verse-arabic: تَاللَّهِ إِن كُنَّا لَفِي ضَلَالٍ مُّبِينٍ
3029.verse-english: "By Allah, we were indeed in manifest error

clauses-english.clause: "By God,
we were indeed in manifest error

3030.verse-english: When we equated you with the Lord of the worlds.

clauses-english.clause: When we equated you with the Lord of the worlds.

3031.verse-english: And no one misguided us except the criminals.

clauses-english.clause: And no one misguided us except the criminals.

3032.verse-english: So now we have no intercessors

clauses-english.clause: So now we have no intercessors
And not a devoted friend.

3034.verse-arabic: فَلَوْ أَنَّ لَنَا كَرَّةً فَنَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
3034.verse-english: Then if we only had a return [to the world] and could be of the believers... "

clauses-english.clause: Then if we only had a return [to the world] and could be of the believers...

3035.verse-arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
3035.verse-english: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed in that is a sign,
but most of them were not to be believers.

3036.verse-english: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

clauses-english.clause: And indeed,
your Lord -
He is the Exalted in Might,
the Merciful.

3037.verse-english: The people of Noah denied the messengers

clauses-english.clause: The people of Noah denied the messengers

3038.verse-arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ نُوحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
3038.verse-english: When their brother Noah said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?

clauses-english.clause: When their brother Noah said to them,
"Will you not fear God?

3039.verse-english: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

3040.verse-english: So fear Allah and obey me.

clauses-english.clause: So fear God and obey me.

3041.verse-arabic: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
3041.verse-english: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

clauses-english.clause: And I do not ask you for it any payment.
My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

3042.verse-english: So fear Allah and obey me."

clauses-english.clause: So fear God and obey me.

3043.verse-english: They said, "Should we believe you while you are followed by the lowest [class of people]?"

clauses-english.clause: They said,
"Should we believe you while you are followed by the lowest [class of people]?

3044.verse-arabic: قَالَ وَمَا عِلْمِي بِمَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
3044.verse-english: He said, "And what is my knowledge of what they used to do?

clauses-english.clause: He said,
"And what is my knowledge of what they used to do?

3045.verse-arabic: إِنْ حِسَابُهُمْ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّي ۖ لَوْ تَشْعُرُونَ
3045.verse-english: Their account is only upon my Lord, if you [could] perceive.

clauses-english.clause: Their account is only upon my Lord,
if you [could] perceive.

3046.verse-english: And I am not one to drive away the believers.

clauses-english.clause: And I am not one to drive away the believers.

3047.verse-english: I am only a clear warner."

clauses-english.clause: I am only a clear warner.

3048.verse-arabic: قَالُوا لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ يَا نُوحُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الْمَرْجُومِينَ
3048.verse-english: They said, "If you do not desist, O Noah, you will surely be of those who are stoned."

clauses-english.clause: They said,
"If you do not desist,
O Noah,
you will surely be of those who are stoned.

3049.verse-english: He said, "My Lord, indeed my people have denied me.

clauses-english.clause: He said,
"My Lord,
indeed my people have denied me.

3050.verse-arabic: فَافْتَحْ بَيْنِي وَبَيْنَهُمْ فَتْحًا وَنَجِّنِي وَمَن مَّعِيَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
3050.verse-english: Then judge between me and them with decisive judgement and save me and those with me of the believers."

clauses-english.clause: Then judge between me and them with decisive judgement and save me and those with me of the believers.

3051.verse-arabic: فَأَنجَيْنَاهُ وَمَن مَّعَهُ فِي الْفُلْكِ الْمَشْحُونِ
3051.verse-english: So We saved him and those with him in the laden ship.

clauses-arabic.clause: فَأَنجَيْنَاهُ وَمَن مَّعَهُ فِي الْفُلْكِ الْمَشْحُونِ

clauses-english.clause: So We saved him and those with him in the laden ship.

3052.verse-english: Then We drowned thereafter the remaining ones.

clauses-english.clause: Then We drowned thereafter the remaining ones.

3053.verse-arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
3053.verse-english: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed in that is a sign,
but most of them were not to be believers.

3054.verse-english: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

clauses-english.clause: And indeed,
your Lord -
He is the Exalted in Might,
the Merciful.
'Aad denied the messengers

3056.verse-arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ هُودٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
3056.verse-english: When their brother Hud said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?

clauses-english.clause: When their brother Hud said to them,
"Will you not fear God?

3057.verse-english: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

3058.verse-english: So fear Allah and obey me.

clauses-english.clause: So fear God and obey me.

3059.verse-arabic: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
3059.verse-english: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

clauses-english.clause: And I do not ask you for it any payment.
My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

3060.verse-english: Do you construct on every elevation a sign, amusing yourselves,

clauses-english.clause: Do you construct on every elevation a sign,
amusing yourselves,

3061.verse-english: And take for yourselves palaces and fortresses that you might abide eternally?

clauses-english.clause: And take for yourselves palaces and fortresses that you might abide eternally?

3062.verse-english: And when you strike, you strike as tyrants.

clauses-english.clause: And when you strike,
you strike as tyrants.

3063.verse-english: So fear Allah and obey me.

clauses-english.clause: So fear God and obey me.

3064.verse-english: And fear He who provided you with that which you know,

clauses-english.clause: And fear He who provided you with that which you know,

3065.verse-english: Provided you with grazing livestock and children

clauses-english.clause: Provided you with grazing livestock and children
And gardens and springs.

3067.verse-arabic: إِنِّي أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
3067.verse-english: Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a terrible day."

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
I fear for you the punishment of a terrible day.

3068.verse-arabic: قَالُوا سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْنَا أَوَعَظْتَ أَمْ لَمْ تَكُن مِّنَ الْوَاعِظِينَ
3068.verse-english: They said, "It is all the same to us whether you advise or are not of the advisors.

clauses-english.clause: They said,
"It is all the same to us whether you advise or are not of the advisors.

3069.verse-english: This is not but the custom of the former peoples,

clauses-english.clause: This is not but the custom of the former peoples,

3070.verse-english: And we are not to be punished."

clauses-english.clause: And we are not to be punished.

3071.verse-arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَهْلَكْنَاهُمْ ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
3071.verse-english: And they denied him, so We destroyed them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

clauses-english.clause: And they denied him,
so We destroyed them.
Indeed in that is a sign,
but most of them were not to be believers.

3072.verse-english: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

clauses-english.clause: And indeed,
your Lord -
He is the Exalted in Might,
the Merciful.
Thamud denied the messengers

3074.verse-arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ صَالِحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
3074.verse-english: When their brother Salih said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?

clauses-english.clause: When their brother Salih said to them,
"Will you not fear God?

3075.verse-english: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

3076.verse-english: So fear Allah and obey me.

clauses-english.clause: So fear God and obey me.

3077.verse-arabic: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
3077.verse-english: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

clauses-english.clause: And I do not ask you for it any payment.
My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

3078.verse-english: Will you be left in what is here, secure [from death],

clauses-english.clause: Will you be left in what is here,
secure [from death],
Within gardens and springs

3080.verse-english: And fields of crops and palm trees with softened fruit?

clauses-english.clause: And fields of crops and palm trees with softened fruit?

3081.verse-english: And you carve out of the mountains, homes, with skill.

clauses-english.clause: And you carve out of the mountains,
homes,
with skill.

3082.verse-english: So fear Allah and obey me.

clauses-english.clause: So fear God and obey me.

3083.verse-english: And do not obey the order of the transgressors,

clauses-english.clause: And do not obey the order of the transgressors,

3084.verse-arabic: الَّذِينَ يُفْسِدُونَ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَا يُصْلِحُونَ
3084.verse-english: Who cause corruption in the land and do not amend."

clauses-english.clause: Who cause corruption in the land and do not amend.

3085.verse-english: They said, "You are only of those affected by magic.

clauses-english.clause: They said,
"You are only of those affected by magic.

3086.verse-arabic: مَا أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُنَا فَأْتِ بِآيَةٍ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ
3086.verse-english: You are but a man like ourselves, so bring a sign, if you should be of the truthful."

clauses-english.clause: You are but a man like ourselves,
so bring a sign,
if you should be of the truthful.

3087.verse-arabic: قَالَ هَٰذِهِ نَاقَةٌ لَّهَا شِرْبٌ وَلَكُمْ شِرْبُ يَوْمٍ مَّعْلُومٍ
3087.verse-english: He said, "This is a she-camel. For her is a [time of] drink, and for you is a [time of] drink, [each] on a known day.

clauses-english.clause: He said,
"This is a she-
camel.
For her is a [time of] drink,
and for you is a [time of] drink,
[each] on a known day.

3088.verse-arabic: وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوءٍ فَيَأْخُذَكُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
3088.verse-english: And do not touch her with harm, lest you be seized by the punishment of a terrible day."

clauses-english.clause: And do not touch her with harm,
lest you be seized by the punishment of a terrible day.

3089.verse-english: But they hamstrung her and so became regretful.

clauses-english.clause: But they hamstrung her and so became regretful.

3090.verse-arabic: فَأَخَذَهُمُ الْعَذَابُ ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
3090.verse-english: And the punishment seized them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

clauses-english.clause: And the punishment seized them.
Indeed in that is a sign,
but most of them were not to be believers.

3091.verse-english: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

clauses-english.clause: And indeed,
your Lord -
He is the Exalted in Might,
the Merciful.

3092.verse-english: The people of Lot denied the messengers

clauses-english.clause: The people of Lot denied the messengers

3093.verse-arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ لُوطٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
3093.verse-english: When their brother Lot said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?

clauses-english.clause: When their brother Lot said to them,
"Will you not fear God?

3094.verse-english: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

3095.verse-english: So fear Allah and obey me.

clauses-english.clause: So fear God and obey me.

3096.verse-arabic: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
3096.verse-english: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

clauses-english.clause: And I do not ask you for it any payment.
My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

3097.verse-english: Do you approach males among the worlds

clauses-english.clause: Do you approach males among the worlds

3098.verse-arabic: وَتَذَرُونَ مَا خَلَقَ لَكُمْ رَبُّكُم مِّنْ أَزْوَاجِكُم ۚ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌ عَادُونَ
3098.verse-english: And leave what your Lord has created for you as mates? But you are a people transgressing."

clauses-english.clause: And leave what your Lord has created for you as mates?
But you are a people transgressing.

3099.verse-arabic: قَالُوا لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ يَا لُوطُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الْمُخْرَجِينَ
3099.verse-english: They said, "If you do not desist, O Lot, you will surely be of those evicted."

clauses-english.clause: They said,
"If you do not desist,
O Lot,
you will surely be of those evicted.

3100.verse-english: He said, "Indeed, I am, toward your deed, of those who detest [it].

clauses-english.clause: He said,
"Indeed,
I am,
toward your deed,
of those who detest [it].

3101.verse-english: My Lord, save me and my family from [the consequence of] what they do."

clauses-english.clause: My Lord,
save me and my family from [the consequence of] what they do.

3102.verse-english: So We saved him and his family, all,

clauses-english.clause: So We saved him and his family,
all,

3103.verse-english: Except an old woman among those who remained behind.

clauses-english.clause: Except an old woman among those who remained behind.
Then We destroyed the others.

3105.verse-arabic: وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِم مَّطَرًا ۖ فَسَاءَ مَطَرُ الْمُنذَرِينَ
3105.verse-english: And We rained upon them a rain [of stones], and evil was the rain of those who were warned.

clauses-english.clause: And We rained upon them a rain [of stones],
and evil was the rain of those who were warned.

3106.verse-arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
3106.verse-english: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed in that is a sign,
but most of them were not to be believers.

3107.verse-english: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

clauses-english.clause: And indeed,
your Lord -
He is the Exalted in Might,
the Merciful.

3108.verse-english: The companions of the thicket denied the messengers

clauses-english.clause: The companions of the thicket denied the messengers

3109.verse-arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ شُعَيْبٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
3109.verse-english: When Shu'ayb said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?

clauses-english.clause: When Shu'ayb said to them,
"Will you not fear God?

3110.verse-english: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

3111.verse-english: So fear Allah and obey me.

clauses-english.clause: So fear God and obey me.

3112.verse-arabic: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
3112.verse-english: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

clauses-english.clause: And I do not ask you for it any payment.
My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

3113.verse-arabic: ۞ أَوْفُوا الْكَيْلَ وَلَا تَكُونُوا مِنَ الْمُخْسِرِينَ
3113.verse-english: Give full measure and do not be of those who cause loss.

clauses-arabic.clause: ۞ أَوْفُوا الْكَيْلَ وَلَا تَكُونُوا مِنَ الْمُخْسِرِينَ

clauses-english.clause: Give full measure and do not be of those who cause loss.

3114.verse-english: And weigh with an even balance.

clauses-english.clause: And weigh with an even balance.

3115.verse-arabic: وَلَا تَبْخَسُوا النَّاسَ أَشْيَاءَهُمْ وَلَا تَعْثَوْا فِي الْأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ
3115.verse-english: And do not deprive people of their due and do not commit abuse on earth, spreading corruption.

clauses-english.clause: And do not deprive people of their due and do not commit abuse on earth,
spreading corruption.

3116.verse-english: And fear He who created you and the former creation."

clauses-english.clause: And fear He who created you and the former creation.

3117.verse-english: They said, "You are only of those affected by magic.

clauses-english.clause: They said,
"You are only of those affected by magic.

3118.verse-arabic: وَمَا أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُنَا وَإِن نَّظُنُّكَ لَمِنَ الْكَاذِبِينَ
3118.verse-english: You are but a man like ourselves, and indeed, we think you are among the liars.

clauses-english.clause: You are but a man like ourselves,
and indeed,
we think you are among the liars.

3119.verse-arabic: فَأَسْقِطْ عَلَيْنَا كِسَفًا مِّنَ السَّمَاءِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ
3119.verse-english: So cause to fall upon us fragments of the sky, if you should be of the truthful."

clauses-english.clause: So cause to fall upon us fragments of the sky,
if you should be of the truthful.

3120.verse-english: He said, "My Lord is most knowing of what you do."

clauses-english.clause: He said,
"My Lord is most knowing of what you do.

3121.verse-arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمِ الظُّلَّةِ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
3121.verse-english: And they denied him, so the punishment of the day of the black cloud seized them. Indeed, it was the punishment of a terrible day.

clauses-english.clause: And they denied him,
so the punishment of the day of the black cloud seized them.
Indeed,
it was the punishment of a terrible day.

3122.verse-arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
3122.verse-english: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed in that is a sign,
but most of them were not to be believers.

3123.verse-english: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

clauses-english.clause: And indeed,
your Lord -
He is the Exalted in Might,
the Merciful.

3124.verse-english: And indeed, the Qur'an is the revelation of the Lord of the worlds.

clauses-english.clause: And indeed,
the Qur'an is the revelation of the Lord of the worlds.

3125.verse-english: The Trustworthy Spirit has brought it down

clauses-english.clause: The Trustworthy Spirit has brought it down

3126.verse-english: Upon your heart, [O Muhammad] - that you may be of the warners -

clauses-english.clause: Upon your heart,
[O Muhammad] -
that you may be of the warners -
In a clear Arabic language.

3128.verse-english: And indeed, it is [mentioned] in the scriptures of former peoples.

clauses-english.clause: And indeed,
it is [mentioned] in the scriptures of former peoples.

3129.verse-arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُمْ آيَةً أَن يَعْلَمَهُ عُلَمَاءُ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ
3129.verse-english: And has it not been a sign to them that it is recognized by the scholars of the Children of Israel?

clauses-arabic.clause: أَوَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُمْ آيَةً أَن يَعْلَمَهُ عُلَمَاءُ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ

clauses-english.clause: And has it not been a sign to them that it is recognized by the scholars of the Children of Israel?

3130.verse-english: And even if We had revealed it to one among the foreigners

clauses-english.clause: And even if We had revealed it to one among the foreigners

3131.verse-arabic: فَقَرَأَهُ عَلَيْهِم مَّا كَانُوا بِهِ مُؤْمِنِينَ
3131.verse-english: And he had recited it to them [perfectly], they would [still] not have been believers in it.

clauses-english.clause: And he had recited it to them [perfectly],
they would [still] not have been believers in it.

3132.verse-english: Thus have We inserted disbelief into the hearts of the criminals.

clauses-english.clause: Thus have We inserted disbelief into the hearts of the criminals.

3133.verse-arabic: لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُا الْعَذَابَ الْأَلِيمَ
3133.verse-english: They will not believe in it until they see the painful punishment.

clauses-arabic.clause: لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُا الْعَذَابَ الْأَلِيمَ

clauses-english.clause: They will not believe in it until they see the painful punishment.

3134.verse-english: And it will come to them suddenly while they perceive [it] not.

clauses-english.clause: And it will come to them suddenly while they perceive [it] not.

3135.verse-english: And they will say, "May we be reprieved?"

clauses-english.clause: And they will say,
"May we be reprieved?

3136.verse-english: So for Our punishment are they impatient?

clauses-english.clause: So for Our punishment are they impatient?

3137.verse-english: Then have you considered if We gave them enjoyment for years

clauses-english.clause: Then have you considered if We gave them enjoyment for years

3138.verse-english: And then there came to them that which they were promised?

clauses-english.clause: And then there came to them that which they were promised?

3139.verse-arabic: مَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا يُمَتَّعُونَ
3139.verse-english: They would not be availed by the enjoyment with which they were provided.

clauses-arabic.clause: مَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا يُمَتَّعُونَ

clauses-english.clause: They would not be availed by the enjoyment with which they were provided.

3140.verse-arabic: وَمَا أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا لَهَا مُنذِرُونَ
3140.verse-english: And We did not destroy any city except that it had warners

clauses-arabic.clause: وَمَا أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا لَهَا مُنذِرُونَ

clauses-english.clause: And We did not destroy any city except that it had warners

3141.verse-english: As a reminder; and never have We been unjust.

clauses-english.clause: As a reminder;
and never have We been unjust.

3142.verse-english: And the devils have not brought the revelation down.

clauses-english.clause: And the devils have not brought the revelation down.

3143.verse-english: It is not allowable for them, nor would they be able.

clauses-english.clause: It is not allowable for them,
nor would they be able.

3144.verse-english: Indeed they, from [its] hearing, are removed.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed they,
from [its] hearing,
are removed.

3145.verse-arabic: فَلَا تَدْعُ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُعَذَّبِينَ
3145.verse-english: So do not invoke with Allah another deity and [thus] be among the punished.

clauses-arabic.clause: فَلَا تَدْعُ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُعَذَّبِينَ

clauses-english.clause: So do not invoke with God another deity and [thus] be among the punished.

3146.verse-english: And warn, [O Muhammad], your closest kindred.

clauses-english.clause: And warn,
[O Muhammad],
your closest kindred.

3147.verse-arabic: وَاخْفِضْ جَنَاحَكَ لِمَنِ اتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
3147.verse-english: And lower your wing to those who follow you of the believers.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَاخْفِضْ جَنَاحَكَ لِمَنِ اتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ

clauses-english.clause: And lower your wing to those who follow you of the believers.

3148.verse-arabic: فَإِنْ عَصَوْكَ فَقُلْ إِنِّي بَرِيءٌ مِّمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
3148.verse-english: And if they disobey you, then say, "Indeed, I am disassociated from what you are doing."

clauses-english.clause: And if they disobey you,
then say,
"Indeed,
I am disassociated from what you are doing.

3149.verse-english: And rely upon the Exalted in Might, the Merciful,

clauses-english.clause: And rely upon the Exalted in Might,
the Merciful,

3150.verse-english: Who sees you when you arise

clauses-english.clause: Who sees you when you arise

3151.verse-english: And your movement among those who prostrate.

clauses-english.clause: And your movement among those who prostrate.

3152.verse-english: Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
He is the Hearing,
the Knowing.

3153.verse-arabic: هَلْ أُنَبِّئُكُمْ عَلَىٰ مَن تَنَزَّلُ الشَّيَاطِينُ
3153.verse-english: Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend?

clauses-arabic.clause: هَلْ أُنَبِّئُكُمْ عَلَىٰ مَن تَنَزَّلُ الشَّيَاطِينُ

clauses-english.clause: Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend?

3154.verse-english: They descend upon every sinful liar.

clauses-english.clause: They descend upon every sinful liar.

3155.verse-english: They pass on what is heard, and most of them are liars.

clauses-english.clause: They pass on what is heard,
and most of them are liars.

3156.verse-english: And the poets - [only] the deviators follow them;

clauses-english.clause: And the poets -
[only] the deviators follow them;

3157.verse-arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّهُمْ فِي كُلِّ وَادٍ يَهِيمُونَ
3157.verse-english: Do you not see that in every valley they roam

clauses-arabic.clause: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّهُمْ فِي كُلِّ وَادٍ يَهِيمُونَ

clauses-english.clause: Do you not see that in every valley they roam

3158.verse-english: And that they say what they do not do? -

clauses-english.clause: And that they say what they do not do?

3159.verse-arabic: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ وَذَكَرُوا اللَّهَ كَثِيرًا وَانتَصَرُوا مِن بَعْدِ مَا ظُلِمُوا ۗ وَسَيَعْلَمُ الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا أَيَّ مُنقَلَبٍ يَنقَلِبُونَ
3159.verse-english: Except those [poets] who believe and do righteous deeds and remember Allah often and defend [the Muslims] after they were wronged. And those who have wronged are going to know to what [kind of] return they will be returned.

clauses-english.clause: Except those [poets] who believe and do righteous deeds and remember God often and defend [the Muslims] after they were wronged.
And those who have wronged are going to know to what [kind of] return they will be returned.
